awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Mathematical Problems in             Electromagnetism and Elasticity
awd_abstract_narration: This project involves mathematical modeling of                             electromagnetic and elastic materials.  These materials are                     characterized by equilibrium configurations exhibiting multiple                 phases.  Examples include elastic ferromagnets and rigid                        superconductors.  The basic modeling tools will be the use of                   spatially nonlocal energy terms to penalize oscillations in                     classical states and the variance of Young-measure states.  Also                included are existence results for short time dynamics of                       materials satisfying a generalized strong ellipticity hypothesis                on electromagnetic and elastic properties and existence of                      equilibrium solutions for elastic bodies with perfect                           diamagnetism (elastic superconductors.)                                              These studies will lead to a better understanding of the                   mechanical properties of elastic and electromagnetic materials                  and composites and will have an impact on the development and                   synthesis of materials with optimal properties.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.inst_name: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
